title: CTA Block
description: PRIMARY CONVERSION ELEMENT - Call-to-action block combining heading, description, and buttons with marketing enhancements like trust signals, urgency elements, and background variants. Critical for driving user actions and conversions.

marketingContext.purpose: Final conversion push before footer on marketing pages
marketingContext.conversionImpact: Critical - where 15-25% of conversions happen with trust signals
bestPractices: Place before footer on every major page
Use trust signals (customer count, ratings) to increase conversions by 15-25%
Add urgency elements (countdown, scarcity) to create FOMO
Test headline, CTA copy, and background variants extensively
Ensure mobile buttons are full-width with 44px minimum height
abTestRecommendations: Urgency: With countdown timer vs. Without
Social proof: With customer count vs. Without
Layout: Centered vs. Horizontal split with image
Background: Gradient vs. Solid vs. Image

layout.description: Layout style for the CTA block

examples.description: Default centered layout - headline and CTA centered with generous padding
examples.useCase: Primary conversion blocks, hero CTAs, most prominent placement

examples.description: Horizontal split layout - image/illustration on one side, content on other
examples.useCase: Mid-page CTAs with product screenshots, demo videos, or illustrations

examples.description: Inline horizontal layout - less prominent, compact spacing
examples.useCase: Secondary CTAs, less critical conversion points, newsletter signups

type.description: Background type: default (light gray), primary (brand color), gradient (bold), gradient-subtle (soft), image (with overlay)

overlay.description: Overlay type for image backgrounds to ensure text readability

eyebrow.description: Small label text above heading (optional) - e.g., 'Limited Time Offer', 'New Feature'

headline.description: Main heading text (REQUIRED) - the primary conversion message

subheadline.description: Supporting text below headline (optional) - reinforces value proposition

description.description: Body text explaining the CTA (REQUIRED) - details the benefit or action

primary.description: Primary CTA button (REQUIRED) - main conversion action

text.description: Button text - use first-person, action verbs (Start, Get, Claim, Join)

trustSignal.description: Trust signal text or HTML markup below CTAs (optional) - increases conversions by 15-25%
examples: Trusted by companies like Microsoft, Google, and Amazon
No credit card required • Cancel anytime

urgency.description: Urgency element text or HTML markup (optional) - creates FOMO (fear of missing out)

visual.description: Image URL or HTML markup for split layout visual side

requirements: Heading level is configurable (h1-h6) for proper document outline
CTA buttons meet 44x44px touch target minimum (WCAG 2.1 Level AAA)
Color contrast meets 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for UI elements
Background overlays ensure text readability on images
Focus states clearly visible with 3px outline, 2px offset
Trust signals use proper semantic markup
accessibility.keyboardNavigation: All CTA buttons are keyboard accessible with visible focus states

optimizations: Lazy loading on split layout images
Minimal DOM nesting for fast rendering

breakpoints.mobile: Full-width buttons, stacked layout, visual-first order
breakpoints.desktop: Split layout side-by-side, inline layout horizontal

behavior: Split layout stacks vertically on mobile (<768px)
Inline layout stacks vertically on mobile
Visual appears first on mobile for immediate impact

darkMode.support: Full dark mode support with semantic color tokens
features: Automatic color switching via CSS custom properties
Urgency element background adjusted for dark mode

All text colors maintain WCAG AA contrast in dark mode
